   20: 
   21: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   22: -moduledoc false.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,render_non_native/1]).
   28: -export([render_function/1, render_type/1, render_callback/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([execute/3]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,{minutes,30}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [ {group, render},
   42:       {group, prop},
   43:       {group, render_smoke}
   44:     ].
   45: 
   46: groups() ->
   47:     [ {prop,[],[render_prop]},
   48:       {render, [], [render, render_non_native, links, normalize]},
   49:       {render_smoke, [], [render_function, render_type, render_callback]}
   50:     ].
   51: 
   52: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   53: %% is rendered correctly.
   54: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   55:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   56:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   65:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   66: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   67:     Config.
   68: 
   69: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   73: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   74: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   75: %%
   76: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   77: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   78: %%
   79: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   80: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   81: %% tested.
   82: %%
   83: %% Currently the modules are:
   84: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
   85: %% If you need to update the definition because this
   86: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
   87: render(Config) ->
   88: 
   89:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   90: 
   91:     lists:foreach(
   92:       fun(Module) ->
   93:               maps:map(
   94:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
   95:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
   96:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
   97:                                 ok;
   98:                             {ok, Original} ->
   99:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
  100:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
  101:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
  102:                             {error, enoent} ->
  103:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
  104:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
  105:                                 %% available on windows.
  106:                                 ok
  107:                         end
  108:                 end, render_module(Module, DataDir))
  109:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  110: 
  111: update_render() ->
  112:     update_render(
  113:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  114:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  115: update_render(DataDir) ->
  116:     lists:foreach(
  117:       fun(Module) ->
  118:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  119:                   {ok, Docs} ->
  120:                       NewEntries =
  121:                           case beam_lib:chunks(find_path(Module),[abstract_code]) of
  122:                               {ok,{Module,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,AST}}]}} ->
  123:                                   lists:map(fun({{Type, F, A}, Anno, Sig, #{} = Doc, Meta} = E) ->
  124: 
  125:                                                     case lists:search(
  126:                                                            fun({attribute, _, spec, {FA, _}}) when Type =:= function ->
  127:                                                                    FA =:= {F,A};
  128:                                                               ({attribute, _, What, {Name, _, Args}}) when What =:= Type; What =:= opaque andalso Type =:= type ->
  129:                                                                    {Name,length(Args)} =:= {F,A};
  130:                                                               (_) ->
  131:                                                                    false
  132:                                                            end, AST) of
  133:                                                         {value, Signature} ->
  134:                                                             {{Type, F, A}, Anno, Sig, Doc, Meta#{ specification => [Signature] }};
  135:                                                         _ -> throw({did_not_find, E})
  136:                                                     end;
  137:                                                (E) -> E
  138: 
  139:                                             end, Docs#docs_v1.docs);
  140:                               {ok,{shell_docs_SUITE,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} ->
  141:                                   Docs#docs_v1.docs
  142:                           end,
  143: 
  144:                       ok = file:write_file(
  145:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  146:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[Docs#docs_v1{ docs = NewEntries }]));
  147:                   {error, _} ->
  148:                       ok
  149:               end,
  150:               maps:map(
  151:                 fun(FName, Output) ->
  152:                         ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  153:                 end, render_module(Module, DataDir))
  154:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  155: 
  156: find_path(Module) ->
  157:     maybe
  158:         preloaded ?= code:which(Module),
  159:         PreloadedPath = filename:join(code:lib_dir(erts),"ebin"),
  160:         filename:join(PreloadedPath, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam")
  161:     else
  162:         Other -> Other
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: handle_error({error,_}) ->
  166:   ok;
  167: handle_error(Doc) ->
  168:   unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc).
  169: 
  170: only_if_smp(Func) ->
  171:     only_if_smp(4, Func).
  172: only_if_smp(Schedulers, Func) ->
  173:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  174:       N when N < Schedulers -> {skip,"Too few schedulers online"};
  175:       _ -> Func()
  176:     end.
  177: 
  178: %%
  179: %% Render function
  180: %%
  181: %% This function tests that OTP code base can print its documentation
  182: %% in the shell. It is a time consuming operation that can take
  183: %% up-to 40 - 50 min if run in a single processor (1 scheduler config) machine.
  184: %%
  185: %% Skip the test case when running in a machine with not enough SMP.
  186: %%
  187: %% OBS. render_type/render_callback have shorter times and do not need
  188: %%      to be skipped, regardless of the number of available schedulers.
  189: %% 
  190: render_function(_Config) ->
  191:   only_if_smp(fun render_function_do/0).
  192: 
  193: render_function_do() ->
  194:     docsmap(
  195:       fun(Mod, D) ->
  196:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  197:               Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  198:                         catch _:undef -> []
  199:                         end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  200:               pmap(
  201:                 fun(Config) ->
  202:                         try
  203:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  204:                             [try
  205:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  206:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  207:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  208:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  209:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  210:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports]
  211:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  212:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  213:                                 exit(R)
  214:                         end
  215:                 end, format_configurations())
  216:       end),
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: render_type(_Config) ->
  220:     docsmap(
  221:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  222:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  223:               pmap(
  224:                 fun(Config) ->
  225:                         try
  226:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  227:                           [try
  228:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  229:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  230:                                io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  231:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  232:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  233:                            end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  234:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  235:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  236:                             exit(R)
  237:                         end
  238:                 end, format_configurations())
  239:       end),
  240:   ok.
  241: 
  242: render_callback(_Config) ->
  243:     docsmap(
  244:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  245:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  246:               pmap(
  247:                 fun(Config) ->
  248:                         try
  249:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  250:                           [try
  251:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  252:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  253:                                io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  254:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  255:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  256:                            end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  257:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  258:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  259:                             exit(R)
  260:                         end
  261:                 end, format_configurations())
  262:       end),
  263:     ok.
  264: 
  265: docsmap(Fun) ->
  266:   F = fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  267:             F(Mod);
  268:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  269:             F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  270:           F(Mod) ->
  271:             case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  272:               {error, missing} ->
  273:                 ok;
  274:               {error, cover_compiled} ->
  275:                 ok;
  276:               {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  277:                 %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  278:                 ok;
  279:               {error, eisdir} ->
  280:                 %% Uhm?
  281:                 ok;
  282:               {ok, Docs} ->
  283:                 try
  284:                   _ = Fun(Mod, Docs),
  285:                   {ok, self(), Mod}
  286:                 catch E:R:ST ->
  287:                     io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  288:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  289:                 end
  290:             end
  291:       end,
  292:   lists:foreach(F, code:all_available()),
  293:   ok.
  294: 
  295: 
  296: format_configurations() ->
  297:   [#{},
  298:    #{ ansi => false },
  299:    #{ ansi => true },
  300:    #{ columns => 5 },
  301:    #{ columns => 150 },
  302:    #{ encoding => unicode },
  303:    #{ encoding => latin1 }].
  304: 
  305: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  306:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  307:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  308:     case Format of
  309:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  310:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  311:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  312:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  313:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  314:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  315:         _  ->
  316:             Docs
  317:     end.
  318: 
  319: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  320: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  321:     Doc;
  322: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  323:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  324: 
  325: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  326:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  327: 
  328: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  329:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  330: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  331:     Entry;
  332: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  333:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  334:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  335: 
  336: 
  337: render_prop(Config) ->
  338: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  339:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  340:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  341: 
  342: links(_Config) ->
  343:     docsmap(
  344:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  345:               try
  346:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  347:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  348:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  349:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  350:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  351:               end,
  352:               [try
  353:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  354:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  355:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  356:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  357:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  358:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  359:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  360:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  361:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  362:       end).
  363: 
  364: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  365:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  366:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  367:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  368:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  369:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  370:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  371:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  372:                                                     b2a(Func),
  373:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  374:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  375:                                                 b2a(Func),
  376:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  377:                                 _Else  -> ok
  378:                             end;
  379:                         _Else ->
  380:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  381:                     end;
  382:                 _Callback ->
  383:                     ok
  384:             end;
  385:         _OtherlinkType ->
  386:             ok
  387:     end,
  388:     check_links(Mod, C),
  389:     check_links(Mod, T);
  390: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  391:     check_links(Mod, C),
  392:     check_links(Mod, T);
  393: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  394:     check_links(Mod, T);
  395: check_links(_, []) ->
  396:     ok.
  397: 
  398: normalize(_Config) ->
  399:     ?assertMatch(
  400:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  401:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  402:       ),
  403:     ?assertMatch(
  404:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  405:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  406:       ),
  407:     ok.
  408: 
  409: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  410: b2a(Bin) ->
  411:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  412:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  413:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  414:     end.
  415: 
  416: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  417: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  418:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  419:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  420:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  421:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  422:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  423:         docs = []
  424:     },
  425: 
  426:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  427:       "    This is\n"
  428:       "    \n"
  429:       "    pure text\n">> =
  430:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  431:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  432: 
  433:     ok.
  434: 
  435: %% Testing functions
  436: render_all(Dir) ->
  437:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  438:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  439:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  440:     %% belongs to.
  441:     PossibleApplications =
  442:         lists:flatmap(
  443:           fun(P) ->
  444:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  445:           end, code:get_path()),
  446:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  447:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  448:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  449:                     maps:map(
  450:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  451:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  452:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  453:             end).
  454: 
  455: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  456:     put({shell_docs, nospecs}, non_existing),
  457:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  458:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  459:         {ok, App} ->
  460:             App;
  461:         _ ->
  462:             App = unknown
  463:     end,
  464:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  465:     Files =
  466:         #{
  467:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  468:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  469:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  470:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  471:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  472:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  473:          },
  474:     lists:foldl(
  475:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  476:               Acc;
  477:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  478:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  479:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  480:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  481:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  482:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  483:                   true -> 
  484:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  485:                   false ->
  486:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  487:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  488:               end;
  489:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  490:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  491:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  492:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  493:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  494:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  495:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  496:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  497:       end, Files, Docs);
  498: render_module(Mod, Datadir) ->
  499:     {ok, [Docs]} = file:consult(filename:join(Datadir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".docs_v1")),
  500:     render_module(Mod, Docs).
  501: 
  502: sanitize(FName) ->
  503:     lists:foldl(
  504:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  505:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  506:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  507:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  508: 
  509: %%
  510: %% Parallel map function.
  511: %%
  512: %% Parallel map function that discards the result of the function
  513: %% `F` applied to each of the items in `Ls`. It spawns as many
  514: %% processes as items there are in `Ls`. If the list is large,
  515: %% consider adding a set of working processes that round-robin on
  516: %% the job to do be done.
  517: %%
  518: %% - `F` is the function to perform
  519: %% - `Ls` the list of items to iterate on
  520: %%
  521: pmap(F, Ls) when is_function(F),
  522:                  is_list(Ls) ->
  523:   _ = lists:foreach(fun(Config) ->
  524:                         spawn_link(?MODULE, execute,[Config, F, self()])
  525:                    end, Ls),
  526:   ResponseCounter = length(Ls),
  527:   ok = sync(ResponseCounter),
  528:   ok.
  529: 
  530: execute(Item, F, Pid) ->
  531:   _ = F(Item),
  532:   Pid ! ok.
  533: 
  534: sync(0) ->
  535:   ok;
  536: sync(N) ->
  537:   receive
  538:     ok ->
  539:       sync(N-1)
  540:   end.
